byline.contributor: Michael de la Merced contributed reporting.

abstract: Hewlett-Packard reports fiscal second quarter net income of $1 billion, fall of 21 percent from year earlier, and revenue of $25.5 billion, decline of 7 percent; chief executive Meg Whitman tells investors figures suggest support for decision to split HP into two companies.
lead_paragraph: The computer and printer company plans to split into two entities later this year in hopes of being more nimble, but investors have reservations.

headline.main: Hewlett-Packard Reports Drop in Profit and Sales
headline.print_headline: Profit and Sales Slump at Hewlett-Packard

snippet: The computer and printer company plans to split into two entities later this year in hopes of being more nimble, but investors have reservations.
